questDatabase.description: If I could only use it... Well, hi there my friend. I need your help with a project of mine. I want to create an immense power source, but I have a few problems that I need to solve first. Will you help me? You shall be rewarded.

questDatabase.name: A problem that matters
questDatabase.description:
I need to open a wormhole. But for that, I need an immense gravitational field. One like those created upon the death of a Star. But I can't really "kill" a sun for this. I need to compress matter somehow... 
But... How?

questDatabase.name: Now that matters!
questDatabase.description: Of course! The matter condenser! How come I didn't think of that?

questDatabase.name: I need a stabilizer
questDatabase.description: Opening the wormhole is one thing, but I need to stabilize it, so it doesn't harm anything. I guess I need something made of crystal. Why? Because I like it fancy. Find me a crystal-based, transparent material with immense power, would you?

questDatabase.name: Shiny!
questDatabase.description: What in the World is this? This is amazing! I need more of these! They will be an amazing containment material for the wormhole!

questDatabase.name: I'm hungry
questDatabase.description: What... I work a lot! So get me some food please.

questDatabase.name: It needs a power plug...
questDatabase.description: Given the fact that I will be able to craft this device, it needs some kind of "plug" to get the power out. I need something to conduct immense amounts of power. I thought about superconductors, but they don't fit with the crystal casing material I have in mind. I need 2 different crystals, one for positive and one for negative charge.

questDatabase.name: Red and blue
questDatabase.description: Really? A red and blue crystal? How awesome is that! I think I will need 8 of each color, just to be sure.

questDatabase.name: A casing
questDatabase.description: I need something for the outer shell. Again, a crystal-based material, because I like it shiny. I tested all crystals we know, and none of them meet the requirements. I heard you have access to the space? Can you try to find a suitable material while you're out there?

questDatabase.name: Fancy!
questDatabase.description: Yes. Yes! That's it. Bring me more of this stuff! I probably need a lot of it...

questDatabase.name: Beyond imagination
questDatabase.description: What is this? Draconium dust? I wonder if I could use this for something...

questDatabase.name: The power of dragons
questDatabase.description:
Hey my friend. I got your sample, and I have to say, I'm amazed. This material has a lot of potential, but it's useless at the moment. I have an Idea how to turn this into something useful, but I need you to help me with a few problems first.

I need a good hand full of that stuff for my research. Please get me some.

questDatabase.name: A hull
questDatabase.description: First things first, we need a hull. I played around with your sample, and it seems that I reacts with every known material. It even attacks Iridium! It's completely harmless if it's in a box that is open, but as soon as I try to enclose it in something, poof. It breaks free. We need something stronger than Iridium my friend.

questDatabase.name: Dense, denser, Neutronium
questDatabase.description:
Now look at this. This stuff is incredibly dense. Maybe this material will be sufficient?

This looks promising. Send me some samples, and I will try my luck.

questDatabase.name: Not a planet
questDatabase.description: This place is interesting. Maybe I should try to find new Materials here...

questDatabase.name: Successful.. Or not?
questDatabase.description:
Heh, Neutronium. I didn't even knew such a thing really exists. Unfortunately, the Draconium dust was enclosed for... 5 seconds? But, it was a small success. 

Ok let's travel to some planets and moons and look for the new Material. I think we have to fly very far away for it.

Lore:9: Formerly known as Neutronium
Formerly known as Neutronium

questDatabase.name: Black Plutonium
questDatabase.description:
This doesn't seem to be dense, but it's a Material you haven't seen before. Maybe this could be the solution?

Black what? Huh, interesting. Send me some samples, I want to analyse it.

questDatabase.name: We have a hull
questDatabase.description: Surprisingly, this Material is able to contain the Draconium Dust. It could be the radiation. Good job my friend!

questDatabase.name: Draconium Dust core
questDatabase.description: I've created a first sample of what I shall call "Draconium Dust core". Not quite the result I expected to be honest, but see for yourself.

Lore:9: The first sample. Wait.. Is that... a button?
The first sample. Wait.. Is that... a button?

questDatabase.name: We need to control it
questDatabase.description: The problem is, that the immense power of this dust is released all at once. We need something to control the vast amount of energies. I noticed that the dust starts to glow when it gets near an aura node. Maybe Thaumaturgy has the solution?

questDatabase.name: The power of primals
questDatabase.description: What else could control energies better than a focus of crystallized primal energy? With this little item, it should be possible to control the energies released from the dust.

questDatabase.name: Unforeseen consequences
questDatabase.description: You haven't heard anything in a while from the technician. You have a feeling that something might have gone terrible wrong, so you went to his place to investigate. What you found was... nothing. A void. It seems that he tried to combine the pearl with the dust. What did he say? The dust reacts to Aura nodes? Of course it does. It amplifies the energies by a thousand times. And giving it raw primal energy, good lord, what has he done. May he rest in peace...

Lore:9: A mix of draconium dust, a primordial pearl
and.. Is that a bone?
A mix of draconium dust, a primordial pearl
and.. Is that a bone?

questDatabase.name: I'm on my own now
questDatabase.description: I need to continue my research. I still think that this Primordial pearl is the key to control the dust, but I'm not sure how. Maybe the pearl is just too strong? I should try to use something that's similar, but less powerful. It reacts to Vis, so maybe.. I should try to make a wand focus with that pearl. That way, I could channel Vis into the dust without actually combining both.

questDatabase.name: An interesting Material
questDatabase.description: This metal has quite interesting properties. It seems, that it has absorbed some of the energy that exists in the End. While ender pearls are quite fragile, this Metal is a lot more durable. However, the absorbed energy is not enough to teleport things around. But you might find a solution for this.

questDatabase.name: Gross, what is that...
questDatabase.description: It's purple, and it smells like rotten eggs. But while staring at this unpleasant fluid, you had an idea. You can't reach the dust directly, but can you actually teleport something in and out the field? Might be worth a try.

questDatabase.name: An Appropriate focus
questDatabase.description: You've tried a lot, and nothing was quite enough to activate the Dust. Until now. You finally found a focus that is able to transmit enough power to cause a heavy reaction with the dust, but not enough to cause problems.

questDatabase.name: Activated draconium dust
questDatabase.description: At least for a short period of time. The wand focus is powerful enough to activate the dust, but it will convert back to regular dust as soon as I stop to feed it with Vis. If I only could contain it, surround it with a forcefield...

Lore:9: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

questDatabase.name: The strongest forcefield
questDatabase.description: In order to create a forcefield, I need to build myself a containment device. I will use only the best emitters I can afford. I will take no risks here.

questDatabase.name: Not what I expected...
questDatabase.description: The outcome was... interesting. It did not explode, instead, the activated draconium dust generated a counter-field to mine! Unfortunately, the emitters could not stand the reverse energies, and melted. I was able to shut it off quick enough to save the machine casing (At least what's left from it...) And a couple of field generators.

Lore:9: A pile of something that
used to be a machine hull
A pile of something that
used to be a machine hull
A few scratches here and there,
but still usable

questDatabase.name: Forcefield, second try
questDatabase.description: I came to the following conclusion: Draconium Dust seems to react nicely with all kinds of magic energy, and seems to repel technology. So I need to find a way to create a forcefield with magic alone. There must be a way...

questDatabase.name: A magic force field
questDatabase.description:
While node stabilizers are too weak, you found a way to generate a strong containment field, generated by magic itself. You tried to use warded glass, but even the "frozen in spacetime" material could not resist the power of activated draconium dust. You decided to build another device, this time with your newest invention.

The vortex attenuator is powerful enough to negate even hungry nodes, and it also will be able to contain activated draconium dust.

Just to be sure, I will add some amplifiers to it.

questDatabase.name: What the...?
questDatabase.description: The device works! It is able to fully contain and separate the draconium dust from everything around it! Unfortunately... It also prevents the Vis from passing the barrier, which results in regular draconium dust... In a forcefield...

questDatabase.name: Looking for alternatives
questDatabase.description:
It is frustrating. Either you are able to contain the dust but can't activate it, or, you activate it and it causes serious damage. Maybe you need to find answers somewhere else.

Draconic... Like... Dragon?

Lore:9: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

questDatabase.name: Draconic... Like... Dragon?
questDatabase.description: Maybe you where looking for the right things in the wrong place. As this dust obviously origins from dragons, the best thing to do now is to find answers in the Dimension of Dragons: The End.

questDatabase.name: Weird creatures
questDatabase.description: These ghosts are weird beings. But, I found this ectoplasm, which, by itself, seems to be pretty useless.

questDatabase.name: Activated teleport power
questDatabase.description: By a random guess of yours, you combined molten Ender pearls and a few more of these shards with an empty gem, and it turned blue. It is pulsating with power. You tried to use it on your containment device, and it seems to be able to bypass the force field, while keeping it intact that the same time. Sadly, it doesn't have enough power to let Vis pass through. Maybe you can even further increase the gems power?

questDatabase.name: Arcane shards
questDatabase.description: While the normal world is based on Vis and Primal energy, the end seems to be quite different. This Arcane shard is the crystallized form of this Energy, just like the primal shards that you used so many times in the past. By pure randomness, you discovered that it reacts with the Metal you've found.

questDatabase.name: Draconic Evolution
questDatabase.description: After a long and tedious path, you finally managed to create a device that is able to activate draconium dust, trap it in spacetime, and make use of the vast energies it emits while activated. The result is a perfectly stabilized core, that is completely harmless by itself, but is also able to provide incredible amounts of power on demand.

Lore:9: Emits a strong, vibrating aura of pure energy you never experienced before.
In good memory of your old friend, the technician. May he rest in peace
Emits a strong, vibrating aura of pure energy you never experienced before.
In good memory of your old friend, the technician. May he rest in peace

questDatabase.name: Balanced thaumium
questDatabase.description: This new metal is quite cheap, and has an awesome conductivity towards all 6 primal aspects. Regarding the capsule, I'd say it is a superconductor for vis. I think I can finally assemble the final frame.

questDatabase.name: Automated evolution
questDatabase.description:
The machine is working pretty well, but it's tedious to fill in the reagents manually. But you have an idea, you could use a few basic components to fully automate the process.

You can use robot arms and conveyor belts to automate the input and output.

Obviously, you need to power the machines. A solar panel will do just fine.

In order to automate the catalyst, you need a few things. One golem will gather basic materials, while the second one will hunt creepers and ghasts for the more valuable ingredients.

You found a way to re-use the singularity, so you only need to get some sand. Luckily, the golem that works on the catalyst will be able to get glass too. He just needs a little additional motivation.

Your golems need light, obviously. Also, it would be nice if there are some signal lamps that indicate the status of the process. Would it not?

questDatabase.name: Activated teleport gem
questDatabase.description: You are sure that you've just discovered the solution for your containment problem. This gem happily transmits Vis on request, while keeping the containment field intact. What a great day!

questDatabase.name: You did it! But...
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are able to contain the activated draconium dust for an infinite amount of time, you where able to assure the energy it releases. The readings are incredible. You have never seen such a power before. The only problem is, the machinery required to keep the dust in this state is too large to use it for crafting.

You noticed something that might help: The dust reacts to Vis, but it needs a lot of it, therefore you require the animation focus. If you could find a catalyst, that you can mix the dust with, you could make the dust react with the Vis from its surroundings instead of a direct beam.

Lore:9: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power
Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

questDatabase.name: A catalyst
questDatabase.description:
That's it. This catalyst contains all primal energies in a quite different form, a lot weaker than any node. However, in combination with the draconium dust, it amplifies the Vis that's around it, which leads to a permanent activation. It still needs to be contained, but you don't need the direct Vis beam any more.

The result is a compound, which still emits massive amounts of power, but is less destructive. It still attacks the neutronium, but I think if I can find a capsule-like container that has special properties, I could create a portable version of it.

questDatabase.name: Bulma would be proud
questDatabase.description:
By combining a dimensional singularity with some glass cylinders and molten Gold, I was able to create a miniature containment field within a very small area. Interesting enough, the new draconium blend amplifies the containment field from the inside. Once I fill the blend in the capsule, it immediately "seals" itself. I won't be able to remove or replace the dust any more, but I don't think I have to...


The perfect vessel for massive power!

questDatabase.name: The final steps
questDatabase.description: Now that I've found a way to stabilize the draconium dust and keep it safe in a small capsule, I just need to make a small container for it, so I can drain the energy on demand. Neutronium will serve very well, but I need a magic conductor. Thaumium works, but gets way too hot and Void metal has a bad conductivity. I need to find a magic alloy that is more "balanced" in terms of primal aspects

questDatabase.name: Endless evolution
questDatabase.description: Using your machine, you can now craft infinite amounts of these cores. And since it would be gruesome to let your golem work just for one single core, you decided to only request cores in a large batch of 16. How nice of you.

questDatabase.name: Kill Baba Yaga
questDatabase.description: Baba Yaga is a witch (or one of a trio of sisters of the same name), who appears as a deformed and/or ferocious-looking elderly woman. She flies around in a mortar and wields a pestle. She dwells deep in the forest, in a hut usually described as standing on chicken legs, with a fence decorated with human skulls. Baba Yaga may help or hinder those that encounter or seek her out.

questDatabase.name: Kill Horned Huntsman
questDatabase.description: A Horned Huntsman is a member of the Wild Hunt, a powerful entity created by the Horned God. If one is encountered, prepare for a hard fight, or better flee.

questDatabase.name: Kill Ender Dragon
questDatabase.description: The Dragon must die. Long enough he destroyed those precious endstone blocks!

questDatabase.name: Kill Shade of Leonard
questDatabase.description: Leonard is the demonic being who is rumored to have taught a cadre of German witches their trade, and often presided over their sabbats. A skilled coven with the Witch's Cauldron can summon a Shade of the Demon according to the method described in the Witches' Brews book.

questDatabase.name: Kill Lord of Tormentum
questDatabase.description: A Lord of Torment is a mighty demonic being that is able to create prisons to Torment its victims. Those foolish enough to summon one of these creatures must prepare for an arduous fight.

questDatabase.name: Kill Mog and Gulg
questDatabase.description: Mog and Gulg are the god-like beings that Hobgoblins worship. They may send their avatars to pay witches a visit who exploit their worship (with a Statue of Hobgoblin Patron). Rumor has it that using a Nether Star may make them take immediate notice.

questDatabase.name: Kill Demon
questDatabase.description: Demons are powerful, evil beings who dwell in the infernal dimensions. To date, none have been seen roaming the Nether, where their minions: ghasts, blazes and their ilk seem to dominate. To meet a demon without a way to protect oneself is almost certain death. They are known to hit like a proverbial truck, and require a significant amount of damage to kill. Some demons have even been seen shooting fireballs! They are, of course, also immune to fire.

questDatabase.name: The power of Infinity
questDatabase.description: You've mastered everything possible. And now it's time to give your equipment the final boost. The infinity egg is just the right addition to your Altar. It's quite expensive, but worth the cost.

questDatabase.name: Lava for blood
questDatabase.description: Well, both are red, so that connection was quite obvious... Was it...?

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 slates
questDatabase.description: The basic slates. Basically just stone with blood.

questDatabase.name: See all the things
questDatabase.description: It's quite difficult to see how much blood there is in your altar, or your personal blood network. This little device will solve that problem for you. Just a little prick in the finger, and everything will be revealed.

questDatabase.name: Basic rune
questDatabase.description: The basic rune that you can craft at this moment.

questDatabase.name: Alchemy with blood
questDatabase.description: Not like "BloodAlchemy". You probably will need more than one later, but for now one is sufficient.

questDatabase.name: Potion catalysts
questDatabase.description: In order to manipulate potions you need catalysts. You then combine the ingredient you used to get the potion effect in with either a lengthening or power catalyst to increase the duration or the level of the potion effect.

questDatabase.name: Simple alchemical things
questDatabase.description: Alchemy can be weird, and tedious. There are a lot of reagents and even more possible combinations. For now, and in order to get started, you need a couple of basic things.

questDatabase.name: Refilling your potions
questDatabase.description: If empty, you don't have to throw the potion away. Just refill it.

questDatabase.name: Special potion flasks
questDatabase.description: Regular glass Phials are unable to hold these special potions you want. You need to imbue it with some blood from your altar.

questDatabase.name: Potion: Flight mode
questDatabase.description: Just to give you an idea what is possible. Let's do a sample potion. Shall we? Get yourself a potion flask, a feather and one of your weak binding agents you made. Combine those in the chemistry set, and you'll get something that you'll probably want to keep for a while.

questDatabase.name: Simple, but powerful spells
questDatabase.description: The simple spell system is rather easy to setup, and can be done early on in your bloodmagic career.

questDatabase.name: Paradigm
questDatabase.description: Paradigms shape your spell.

questDatabase.name: Spell foci
questDatabase.description: You have nine basic elements and each have a focus, an item that represents them. You place this focus in your altar next to the spell table in order for your magic to flow through it and the paradigm.

questDatabase.name: Some examples
questDatabase.description: There are a LOT spell combinations to discover, so just trial and error!

questDatabase.name: Convenient slate
questDatabase.description: Collecting items while mining or chopping wood is always tedious. But no more! With this fancy little thing items will just fly towards you! And it only costs a little bit of blood to pay the spirits of wind to work for you.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 slates
questDatabase.description: ...and even more blood.

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 slates
questDatabase.description: You need MOOORE. Imbue some slates with even more blood.

questDatabase.name: Apprentice orb
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 2 orb.

questDatabase.name: Magican's orb
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 3 orb.

questDatabase.name: Elemental chalk
questDatabase.description: Creation of better ritual stones.

questDatabase.name: Sacrificial runes
questDatabase.description: Poking your finger might work for simple slates and runes, but getting enough blood for advanced stuff is tedious. With sacrificial runes you are able to increase the LP gain from mobs or yourself.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 runes
questDatabase.description: The first rune to increase your capacity, and a rune to speed up transfer from/to external tanks.

questDatabase.name: Basic rituals
questDatabase.description: Now that you have access to elemental chalk, you can get yourself the basic ritual diviner. A convenient way to place simple but yet complex rituals.

questDatabase.name: Powerful armor
questDatabase.description: A long way to go, and rather expensive, but a really powerful armor and worth the effort.

questDatabase.name: Getting soul shards
questDatabase.description: Enable your sword with shift+rightclick and slay some enemies! Collect as many shards as possible. You will need a ton of them...

questDatabase.name: Bound armor
questDatabase.description: Time to assemble your armor. You need to build the pattern with blocks as you would craft the armor in a crafting table. The soul forge must connect to the structure on at least 2 sides. Then, right click the forge block with an empty hand for craft the armor.

questDatabase.name: A bloodmage's sword
questDatabase.description: Diamonds and emeralds are limited in their ability to store LP. With this sword, you are able to get the crystallized souls from your enemies. Time to go hunting.

questDatabase.name: Rituals
questDatabase.description: Time for some rituals. The more most basic one you'll probably get first is the ritual of binding.

questDatabase.name: Bound tools: Pickaxe
questDatabase.description: Mining never was easier. Just rightclick with this tool and all the stone is gone! Like all bound tools, this uses a massive amount of LP.

questDatabase.name: Bound tools: Shovel
questDatabase.description: Ever wanted to clear out a large terrain with dirt, gravel and sand? Why not let demons do it? This shovel, imbued with the soul of a demon will unleash the power on your will. But be warned: The demon you're about to summon with this is thirsty, and it costs a lot of LP to make use of it, so make sure your LP pool is full!

questDatabase.name: Bound tools: Axe
questDatabase.description: Upon right click while activated, this axe will clear out any wood within a large area. Be warned: This uses a huge amount of LP. You might suffer from sudden death...

questDatabase.name: A true blood-mage
questDatabase.description: Bloodmagic is fine, so is Thaumcraft. Why not combine both worlds?

questDatabase.name: Complex spell system
questDatabase.description: Unlike the simple spells with foci and paradigm, the complex spell system is incredible... complex. There are way too much combinations to cover them here, so it's advised to check look for the knowledge in other places. However, with the items from this quest, you are able to craft a simple mining spell.

questDatabase.name: Steam > Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Three Steam Backpacks give a better one = Tier 2.

questDatabase.name: Oak trees are not Apple Trees
questDatabase.description: Oak Trees which give Apples?  Who the hell add this to Minecraft? You find a way of combining a oak sapling and an Apple to get a Apple tree sapling. Try to plant one to get a permanent source of Food.

questDatabase.name: Basic > Steam
questDatabase.description: Three Basic Lootbags give a better one = Steam.

questDatabase.name: "Backed" Potatos
questDatabase.description: Eating raw Potatoes isn't that healthy, as you might noticed. Some Potatoes are green and poisonous already. After you get a Furnace you can make delicious Baked Potatoes as an other Food alternative. Put an baked Potato on a stick to make it even more delicious.

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 > Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 2 Backpacks give a better one = Tier 3.

questDatabase.name: Soft Mallet Adventure
questDatabase.description: You have now some melon slices or pumpkins but what you can do with it? Well just eat it or... what you need a mallet to get seeds... OK lets craft one maybe you will need this mallet for some other things too.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 > Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 3 Backpacks give a better one = Tier 4

questDatabase.name: Shields UP
questDatabase.description: Now you hold a Sword in one Hand and what you can do with the other? Right you need a Shield. Let's get some.

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 > Tier 5
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 4 Backpacks give a better one = Tier 5.

questDatabase.name: Shield Update
questDatabase.description: Your wooden Shield is very weak. So you look for a better one, looks like you need leather so go and find some cows.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 > Tier 6
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 5 Backpacks give a better one = Tier 6.

questDatabase.name: Your first long range Weapon
questDatabase.description: Since you can't make any Vanilla Bow before LV and Tinkers Weapons not in this Tier you find a way to make some Spear out of sticks, leather and a string. Get one because some Infernal Monsters are easier to kill with a long range Weapon.

questDatabase.name: Trigger LoC
questDatabase.description: Triggered by having a Lamp of Cinder in the Inventory.

questDatabase.name: Trigger S
questDatabase.description: Triggers by making a Singularity.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Sh
questDatabase.description: Triggers by making a Shard of Creation.

questDatabase.name: Trigger LSS
questDatabase.description: Triggers by making a Life and Soul Shards.

questDatabase.name: Trigger MC
questDatabase.description: Triggered by finding a Mysterious Crystal.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Life
questDatabase.description: Triggers the Life Canister Quest after a Wither death.

questDatabase.name: Trigger P
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you have been on Pluto.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Pr
questDatabase.description: Triggered by the Primordial Pearl.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Fo
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you craft the Primordial Focus.

questDatabase.name: Trigger V
questDatabase.description: Triggers after you craft a Vortex.

questDatabase.name: Trigger TE
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you arrived at The End.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Ca
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you craft the Catalyst.

questDatabase.name: Runes Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Speed rune is the only Tier 2 Rune. The Speed Rune does what its name implies, provides an additive 20% increase to the processing speed of the Blood Altar.

questDatabase.name: The Technician Part 2
questDatabase.description: I will ask the technician about this stuff, but I need to reach a good reputation first. He is a busy man, and I don't want to be denied.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Nt
questDatabase.description: Trigger if you get Neutronium Ore.

questDatabase.name: Trigger BP
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you find Black Plutonium.

questDatabase.name: Trigger VC
questDatabase.description: Trigger if you have a Void Capsule.

questDatabase.name: Trigger Tt
questDatabase.description: Trigger if you get Thaumite Nuggets.

questDatabase.name: Collecting some Berries
questDatabase.description: Are you now waiting that the carrots to grow? Go and find some berry bushes and berries. The berries are a good source of food and you can put these bushes around your house to make a wall. It should provide a good protection against all those monsters that want to come into your house and kill you.

questDatabase.name: Berry Medley
questDatabase.description: Hmmm... what you can do with all those Berries? Just eating? You will see that they have a very low saturation Level. Let's plant the new berry bushes and mix the berries to make some better Food.

questDatabase.name: Food Variants
questDatabase.description: Maybe you noticed already that eating the same food too often is very boring and not healthy any more. Some food like tea leaf can be taken to the furnace and further processed. So take some break and drinking a cup of tea. Maybe munch some tasty raisins they are very good too.

questDatabase.name: Your first Tool
questDatabase.description: After your Tinkers Tables are ready you can craft your First Tool. If you did not found a village first you can craft only flint tools. Let's start with some Pickaxe, Axe and Shovel. Swords are at this point unable to get since they need metals like iron or bronze which you get later. Use your GregTech Swords for the meantime. Your new tools are weak at the moment but the more you are using them the better they get. They will level up to Level 99 if you play long enough. Tool parts can be replaced for a bit of level XP, but the tool must be repaired first.

questDatabase.name: Making a better sword
questDatabase.description: Now its time to make your first Tinkers sword. First you have to make blade, hand guard and tool rod cast form. Melt some Bronze in the smeltery and cast your tool parts. Tada... there is your first TC Sword.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade 2.0
questDatabase.description: Find Iron, Copper and Tin Ore, very funny. How you can mine it which just a flint pickaxe? I have an idea, could you bring me all your Stone your mined with your flint pick and I will give you a better Tool Head in exchange.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #4: Upgrade Tier 5
questDatabase.description: To process more advanced Materials like HSS-E, HSS-S, Naquadah or Draconium you need more than 4500K. Upgrade your EBF to 5400k.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #3: Upgrade Tier 6
questDatabase.description: To process more advanced Materials like Naquadah-Alloy you need more than 5400K. Upgrade your EBF to 7200k.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #6: Upgrade Tier 7
questDatabase.description: To process the most advanced Materials like Neutronium, Fluxed-Electrum or Awakened Draconium you need more than 7200K. Upgrade your EBF to 9001k. (OVER 9000!!!)

questDatabase.name: Flint and Steel
questDatabase.description: After you make Steel you are able to craft Flint and Steel. I guess you want to travel to the Nether as soon as possible but be aware The Nether is very dangerous.

questDatabase.name: THE NETHER
questDatabase.description: Now more dangerous with Extra Hardcore Infernal Mobs. Have fun and take care.

questDatabase.name: Malachite
questDatabase.description: Another Copper source  is "Malachite" and can be found between y 10 and 40. This Vein contains more Iron Ore variants like "Brown Limonite", "Yellow Limonite" and "Banded Iron Ore".

questDatabase.name: Creosote Oil
questDatabase.description:
I guess you already processed a bit of wood into charcoal and wonder what you can do with all this Creosote Oil? 
Well you can burn it in the normal furnace to cook your food or you can make more torches with it. Later in the LV age you probably should run Diesel Generators with it.

questDatabase.name: Animal Farms
questDatabase.description: Trying to get some leather or wool? You probably need to spend a lot of time hunting animals and travelling around, or you can just simply make a farm to get a decent amount of Leather, Wool and Meat.

questDatabase.name: Gardener
questDatabase.description: If you wonder: Why I never get Seeds when destroying Grass? You are right. Try to work with your new Mattock on the Grass Blocks that do not have water anywhere nearby to find some Seeds.

questDatabase.name: Can you hear the Carrots grow?
questDatabase.description:
Tired of waiting since your carrots grow sooooo slow... ?
Well I got an idea, bone meal will help you grow food in seconds. Ok, chop down some trees and I will give you some bone meal.

questDatabase.name: You need MOOOOOOORE Wood
questDatabase.description: It's time to feed your new coke oven with some wood to get more Charcoal. You are looking for the most efficient way to plant trees. Try to find some Spruce Wood Saplings and some Jungle Saplings. both can planted in a 2x2 grid to get bigger trees.

questDatabase.name: Tanned Leather
questDatabase.description: You have found a way to make leather more durable and more resistant by further processing it. Make some Bound Leather from four sheets of Leather, some stings and a Woven Cotton. Now you just have to hang it on a Drying Rack and wait about 10 minutes to get some Tanned Leather.

questDatabase.name: Need more space?
questDatabase.description: As you might know: tanned leather is more resistant and good enough for a backpack. Let's get a Digger Backpack and a Miner Backpack. Each pack holds different items. So use both for your first true back-packed mining experience.

questDatabase.name: You need them all!
questDatabase.description: There are many more Backpacks: Hunter, Builder, Forester...

questDatabase.name: Better Launch Bag
questDatabase.description: Your Launch Bag is now so abused and rather old so it's time to get something better. Let's craft a Launch Box which can hold way more food.

questDatabase.name: Horseback Riding
questDatabase.description: Are you ready for a small trip. With you new Launch Box a Saddle, some Lead and of course a Horse we start a small Journey.

questDatabase.name: Sleeping outside
questDatabase.description: Carrying the bed with you all the time the looks very funny. Why don't you craft a Sleeping Bag to stay outside without placing a bed and changing your spawn point. Be warned: If you play on a Servers better sleep below y 128, nights are very cold in the Mountains...

questDatabase.name: Sheep Hairdresser
questDatabase.description: Killing sheep to get the wool is so ineffective. Making some Shears would make sense if you need more wool.

questDatabase.name: Wire Cutter v.0.2Alpha
questDatabase.description: Small gears require a wire cutter to be made, so let's craft one.

questDatabase.name: Redstone
questDatabase.description: If you didnt't found any Redstone vein, it is quite important to look for one now. Try your luck at Y level 5-40.

questDatabase.name: Oh Shiny (Not Platinum!)
questDatabase.description: To make your first macerator you need two diamonds, and to enter the Twilight Forest you need one. Finding a diamond vein would help you a lot. Go and find some at Y Level 5-20.

questDatabase.name: How to make rubber
questDatabase.description: Making rubber is now more complicated, you need raw rubber and sulfur. Finding a sulfur vein in nether seems like a good idea, isn't it? Found on Y 5-20.

questDatabase.name: More Charcoal
questDatabase.description:
You have found an alternative way of making Charcoal with an "Charcoal Pile Igniter". 
Go and start getting massive amounts of Charcoal.

questDatabase.name: First things first
questDatabase.description: As usual. In order to get started with bees, you need a few basic things. Most important... a scoop.

questDatabase.name: Go find some bees
questDatabase.description: The next thing to do: Find bee hives around the world. There are 11 mundane bees that can be found, where 8 are located in the Overworld. Any kind of bee will work for this quest.

questDatabase.name: A new home
questDatabase.description: Now that you've destroyed the poor bees homes, you should build them a new one.

questDatabase.name: Analyze them all
questDatabase.description: Every bee has multiple properties that define what the bee does, how it behaves in rain or at night, and a couple of other stuff. It is mandatory to keep track of those properties.

questDatabase.name: Scan or not to scan
questDatabase.description: In order to go into bee breeding, you need a way to see all the traits, active and inactive. You only want to breed so called "pure" bees; For those, both "Active" and "Inactive" traits are identical.

questDatabase.name: Top-Tier analyser
questDatabase.description: The best you can get, for all your scanning and analysing needs.

questDatabase.name: To play god
questDatabase.description:
In order to continue with bees, to mutate and breed them as you like, you need mutagen. This greenish, smelly liquid needs to be refined from bacterial sludge, that seems to be available only on Mars. You will be able to continue, once you've arrived there.

In the meantime you can start working with Genetics mod, since we all know Gendustry is too easy... When notice the recipes you will understand why you should look into Genetics mod.

questDatabase.name: Upgraded home
questDatabase.description: The bee house can be used to stabilize mutations, for example if you have successfully bred two different bees, but the passive traits are different from the active ones. Still to actually breed those together, you need something different.

questDatabase.name: Mutatron
questDatabase.description: Mutations can be boring, they can be annoying, and most times, they are frustrating. With this machine, you will get a 100% pure bred mutation. If the combination of princess and drone can result in multiple mutations, the outcome is random. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: Genetic Sampler
questDatabase.description: With this machine, you can extract a random trait from any bee, sapling, butterfly or flower. The bee/sapling/butterfly/flower will be destroyed in this process. Each process requires an empty gene sample and labware.

questDatabase.name: Diamondware
questDatabase.description: Also known as Labware. Be prepared. In order to do serious bee-work, you need stacks of diamonds. I'm not joking, stacks!

questDatabase.name: Genetic Imprinter
questDatabase.description: With this powerful machine, you can inject gene samples, which allows you to alter any aspect of your bee/tree or butterfly. The gene sample (or pattern) will not be destroyed. The success rate is 100%, and one labware is consumed each time.

questDatabase.name: Genetic Transposer
questDatabase.description: DNA samples of species and/or traits are pretty valuable. You always should keep at least one of each effect/trait/species you get your hand on in a chest somewhere save. By using this machine, you are able to copy any DNA sample, for the cost of an empty serum vial and some labware.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Mutatron
questDatabase.description: A more advanced version of the mutatron. It uses more energy to mutate a drone with a princess, but the mutation is a 100% success, and you can select which mutation you want to have. This machine is a must-have for high-tier bees.

questDatabase.name: Blank Gene Sample
questDatabase.description:
To get the various traits from a bee, you need a lot of power, labware and an empty gene sample. You don't need a lot of those, as you can just throw them in a furnace to remove remaining DNA of traits you don't need or want. 

In the meantime you can start working with Genetics mod, since we all know Gendustry is too easy... When notice the recipes you will understand why you should look into Genetics mod.

questDatabase.name: Genetic template
questDatabase.description: Templates are used to combine multiple gene samples into one large batch. It can be used to apply multiple traits at once, but you can also replicate a bee from liquid DNA and protein, if you manage to fill all 13 traits in one template. These templates can also be copied, just like the small samples.

questDatabase.name: A rather cruel disposal
questDatabase.description: You probably will end up with a lot of excess drones while doing bees. (Or saplings if you do trees). Instead of throwing them away, you could also turn them into... Something useful.

questDatabase.name: Arnie's blender
questDatabase.description: They say, breakfast is the most important meal of the day. This machine turns raw meat into liquid protein, which is used to create bees from scratch.

questDatabase.name: And there shall be light
questDatabase.description: Out of princesses to inject traits to? Too lazy to find hives and get more bees? Not a problem. With this nifty little device, you can use a ton of power, liquid DNA and protein to create any bee you wish to have. The only drawback is: All bees will be ignoble, which means they will die after a random amount of cycles.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Temperature 3
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Humidity 3
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Fertility 4
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Highend species: Draconic
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Highend species: Doctoral
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Speed Fastest
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Highend species: Silicon
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Rain
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Day and Night
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Only the Best: Cave
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: Hunger, no more
questDatabase.description: The hunger is constantly following you, consuming you, never letting you rest. The world around you is full of nourishing fruits and vegetables use them to curb your insatiable hunger.

questDatabase.name: Building made easy
questDatabase.description: Placing Blocks by hand can be tedious. Wouldn't it be nice to be able to place Blocks like "Another 9 here"? Well, good news. Get yourself some of the various Building Blocks, and I shall reward you.

questDatabase.name: Spatial Distortions
questDatabase.description: You detected a weird disturbance in the air around an enderman, I suggest you try to steal some of their pearls and research them.

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Chest
questDatabase.description: You've heard rumors, that the Enderman had build Laboratories in the End. To invent new machines and weapons in order to attack the Overworld. One of their Inventions is a chest, which is somehow linked to all instances of itself. Go and try to find one of those.

questDatabase.name: A new Dimension
questDatabase.description: Your investigation into the pearls has shown you that the source of the disturbance seems to be coming out of the shimmering portals inside Strongholds. You feel strangely drawn into its depths.

questDatabase.name: Slay the Eyes!
questDatabase.description: Find and kill Ender-Eyes, guarding the Defence Towers

questDatabase.name: Ender Guardians
questDatabase.description: Well if you decided to grind then do it... Kill some of the guardians.

questDatabase.name: Slay the Dragon. (Again)
questDatabase.description: If you're bored, you can resurrect the Dragon. Or, you could find a ChaosDragon, if you dare. Anyway, kill one of those, and you'll be rewarded.

questDatabase.name: How dark can you go?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, how dark can one be? You are sure the face in that crystal was nothing but imagination...

questDatabase.name: Ascended
questDatabase.description: You feel empowered, light, almost like a ghost.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 slates
questDatabase.description: 1023 Buckets of blood in one slate! How much more I can store, oh I wish I would know. Then I add one and check if it works. 1024 Buckets of blood in one slate! ... ...

questDatabase.name: Powerful shards
questDatabase.description: The demons summoned are rather strong, but their souls contain immense power!

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 slates
questDatabase.description: Tier 4 slates: Getting close.

questDatabase.name: Ethereal chalk
questDatabase.description: Top Tier chalk, for fancy wall paintings?

questDatabase.name: Archmage orb. Let them come!
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 5 orb.

questDatabase.name: Master orb: Getting close
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 4 orb.

questDatabase.name: Elemental chalk II
questDatabase.description: Enhanced elemental chalk, to write "darker" runes than you're used to...

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 runes
questDatabase.description: You will want both runes. Rune of superior capacity to increase the storage of your blood altar, and rune of the orb. Later it is required if you want to advance to higher.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 runes
questDatabase.description: The final frontier: There are not many runes available. The acceleration rune allows you to speed up the interaction with external tanks.

questDatabase.name: Advanced rituals
questDatabase.description: More powerful rituals require dusk runes. With your new dusk chalk, you can enhance your ritual diviner to place those. Allowing you to perform a lot more rituals.

questDatabase.name: Highend rituals
questDatabase.description: The last rune so far, used for the most powerful rituals.

questDatabase.name: Convocation of the damned
questDatabase.description: Time to open a portal to the demons we're using all the time. What could possibly go wrong? (It is recommended to do this ritual on a planet, as the demon city will spread quite a bit...)

questDatabase.name: Imbued spell upgrades
questDatabase.description: With these new shards you are able to craft the most powerful spell components. Maybe it's time to upgrade your mining spell?

questDatabase.name: Don't look in the eyes!
questDatabase.description: Bad things may happen if this creature is allowed to stay alive. And the Ores in the cave are valuable anyway.

questDatabase.name: I don't even...
questDatabase.description: Ok so there is this Maze. And there are... Minotaurs. But what in the world is a Minoshroom?

questDatabase.name: A big ugly snake
questDatabase.description: Required for your first wand and in general, an ugly creature.

questDatabase.name: Adventure time!
questDatabase.description: Stop him before he makes his wish at Prismos'!

questDatabase.name: Who you're gonna call?
questDatabase.description: Phantom Busters! Or wait... Ah whatever. They drop good armor by the way.

questDatabase.name: The big fluffy crybaby
questDatabase.description: It flies, it makes funny sounds, and .. IT'S SO FLUFFY! Well, kill it.

questDatabase.name: Let her go
questDatabase.description: It seems the cold doesn't bother her. Comitted crimes: None. But... you know... you have to progress somehow...

questDatabase.name: Yeti. Alpha, Yeti.
questDatabase.description: Wanted: Alpha Yeti. Death. Committed crimes: Throwing ice at people, violently for no reason.

questDatabase.name: Secret: A nice....
questDatabase.description: Hey, you! I want that lamp. I have something for you in return. You don't need it anyways, do you?

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Creeper)
questDatabase.description: That Who hasn't experienced that yet... You think nothing evil, mine a few Diamonds, and suddenly, you wake up in your bed, all your items gone. Time to strike back!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Pigman)
questDatabase.description: "Zombie Pigman"? What the hell is going on with you Zombies! Maybe you should encase your Animals better at night...

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Spiders)
questDatabase.description: Eeeek! Wall climbing monsters, gross! Slay them. Quickly!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Skeleton)
questDatabase.description: Arrows are nice, if you shoot them. If one hits you, well, bad things happen. (Hint: Arrows are an excellent source of Telum)

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Blaze)
questDatabase.description: You should be careful with this task. Fire protection is highly recommended.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Zombie)
questDatabase.description: Nobody knows who they are, or where they came from. They're just annoying a night, and too stupid to make a crafting table.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Enderman)
questDatabase.description: Uh, fancy teleport pearls. You need them. All of them. Now!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Wither)
questDatabase.description: After collection a couple of those WitherSkeleton heads, you feel like you could need some more action. So why not kill a Wither? You'll need a ton of Netherstars anyway...

questDatabase.name: Secret: The trade for life
questDatabase.description: You have been busy my friend. I have something for you. Give me your hearts, and I will magically enhance them so you can actually use those.

questDatabase.name: Skeleton: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In Order to advance to a higher tier and reach Mars, Deimos and Phobos, you need to make yourself a better rocket. There are rumors, that an evolved Skeleton has Schematics of such a device.

questDatabase.name: Creeper: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Not that regular creepers are nasty enough, no. There is an Evolved Creeper Boss! He is your key (Well he HAS a key...) to reach the next tier of planets (Asteroid Belt, Ceres, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto).

questDatabase.name: Blaze: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed to Tier 5 Planets, the Blaze Boss needs to be killed. Find him in one of the Dungeons on Io.

questDatabase.name: Ghast: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Fluffy, fluffier, Ghasts! And also big crybabies. This one hides in a dungeon on Ceres, and holds the Key for Tier 4 Planets.

questDatabase.name: Crystal Boss: Ayyy.. Wait, what?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, a Crystal Boss? Anyway, it's your key to Tier 6 Planets, and he lurks around on Enceladus.

questDatabase.name: Slime: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Totally looks like a Thaumic Slime to me. Don't you think so? Find this dude on Proteus.

questDatabase.name: Wolf:Evolved
questDatabase.description: The final frontier... A... wolf that is not even an Iron Maiden fan?... What did you expect, a super Boss? Heh. No. Budget was too tight...

questDatabase.name: Technology: Evolved
questDatabase.description: You beat the game, literally. There is nothing left to do, you might want to try real life... But one thing might be interesting for you. You know, just for the phuns. Select one of the totally OP items here.

Lore:9: This! Is OP

questLines.name: Tier 0 - It begins
questLines.description: The very first Tier, Tier zero. This chapter will introduce you to the basic mechanics of this modpack. Mods covered: Vanilla, Pam's Harvestcraft.

questLines.name: Tier 0.5 - Stone Age
questLines.description: Basically the "Tier 0" of all your progression. This set helps you through the first tier until you can build your first steam machine

questLines.name: Tier 1 - Steam
questLines.description: Quest set for all steam-based machines.

questLines.name: Tier 2 - 32 EU (LV)
questLines.description: The first "Voltage" Tier of this pack. Things are getting easier...

questLines.name: Tier 3 - 128 EU (MV)
questLines.description: Your second voltage tier. Don't mix different voltage levels, or you will be punished in a hard way.

questLines.name: Tier 4 - 512 EU (HV)
questLines.description: Finally some power to work with. This tier will help you prepare to reach distant planets and gather more rare resources to build even more advanced machines.

questLines.name: Tier 5 - 2048 EU (EV)
questLines.description: Titanium-Level, fissile energy sources, Applied Energistics 2.

questLines.name: Tier 6 and beyond
questLines.description: The last regular tier that will "guide" you

questLines.name: Novice Thaumaturge
questLines.description: Magic lies beyond. Great achievements, but also a lot of work. I shall be your guide. Follow my instructions, and you shall become a great Wizard, like me.

questLines.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questLines.description: Warp included.

questLines.name: Kaaami, Haaaami, ... HA!
questLines.description: Ultimate (magical) POWER!!!

questLines.name: Alternative Magic
questLines.description: What kind of witchery is this!?

questLines.name: Multiblock Goals
questLines.description: This set is a global tracker for multiblock goals structures. As you can build several parts of many multiblocks way earlier than the respective tier.

questLines.name: Legendary Quests
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Legendary Tier X
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Legendary Infinity
questLines.description: A legendary questline with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Paying the highest price
questLines.description: When regular magic just won't cover it, pay demons to do it for you! The cost might scare some people... But no risk no fun!

questLines.name: More blood, more stuff
questLines.description: Advanced Blood Magic? My veins feel weird...

questLines.name: They are coming...
questLines.description: The spirits that I've called... Demon invasions and beyond. Really deep into dark magic!

questLines.name: Kill all the things
questLines.description: This world is full of nasty things. Time to kill some and improve your reputation.

questLines.name: How to be(e)
questLines.description: An non-tiered quest set that is meant as an in game, quest based tutorial and guide to bees. Since they are a really helpful tool to advance forward.

questLines.name: To grind, or not to grind
questLines.description: That is the question. Do you want good tools? Well, then go grind stuff! The rewards of these quests are worth it, trust me.

questLines.name: Reward Area
questLines.description: Upgrade your loot bags!
